column1: Timimoun (Arabic: ﺗﻴﻤﻴﻤﻮن‎) is a town and commune
column4: south-central Algeria. According to the 2008 census it has a population of 33
column8: with an annual growth rate of 1.5%.Timimoun is known for the red ochre color of its buildings.

column1: The town of Timimoun lies at an elevation of around 288 metres (945 ft) in the Gourara region of northern Adrar Province. It is located on the south-eastern side of an oasis which supports the town's population. A sebkha (salt lake) lies further to the northwest
column2: while the plateau of Tademaït rises to the southeast.

column1: Timimoun has a hot desert climate (Köppen climate classification BWh)
column2: with extremely hot summers and warm winters
column3: with minimal rainfall throughout the year. The annual mean temperature almost reaches 25 °C (77 °F).
